main event: A soldier observed a round reddish orange and blue object with a long tail traveling horizontally in Petersburg, Virginia on February 13, 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 2 to 3 seconds., The soldier estimated the object was traveling at a terrific speed., The sighting occurred visually while the observer was in an automobile., The object first appeared as a ball with a tail and then broke into three parts before disappearing., The conclusion was that it possibly could be a meteor.
sighted object: round object that appeared to be a comet
witness description: Private Rudolph Yards, stationed at Camp Pickett, Virginia.
